author: D Trawick

review: I have been interested in purchasing an Amazon Fire TV for some time now, so when I saw it on sale, I bought it.  I already own a Fire TV Stick which I'm very happy with for use in my bedroom, but I wanted another device for my home theater, and I'm NOT disappointed. The device is well built and preforms flawlessly.The Fire TV definitely outperforms its little brother (the Stick). In my experience, the Stick can be sluggish at times when responding to remote commands and browsing the interface. On the contrary, the Fire TV is always very responsive. This may be because the Fire TV is connected via wired Ethernet and the Stick is using WiFi (only option).As for picture quality; I'd say they're the same. I don't think the casual user would notice any difference, unless your home WiFi network is under-preforming or over loaded.  Although, performance may very based on your available internet bandwidth. I have an 11Mbps DSL service, with very heavy network traffic (5 users with xbox one, PS4, Wii U, laptops, tablets, smartphones, VOIP phone, etc...) and the picture quality is always great on both device. I have yet to experience any hesitation on either device while streaming.I'd recommend the Fire TV to anyone who demands a high performance streaming device. It provides the additional features of optical audio out for high quality sound when connected to  a home theater entertainment system; and wired Ethernet for higher performance LAN connectivity. If these features are not important to you, save some money and get a Fire TV Stick.All-in-all, I'm happy with my purchase, but I will say that at a retail price of $99 they should include an HDMI cable.
